db:abstract.db:para: The QBluetoothTransferManager class transfers data to another device using Object Push Profile (OPP).
This class was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QBluetoothTransferManager uses OBEX to send put commands to remote devices.
Note that this API is not currently supported on Android.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QBluetoothTransferManager::QBluetoothTransferManager(QObject *parent = 0)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new QBluetoothTransferManager with parent.

db:section.db:title: void QBluetoothTransferManager::finished(QBluetoothTransferReply *reply)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the transfer for reply finishes.

db:section.db:title: QBluetoothTransferReply *QBluetoothTransferManager::put(const QBluetoothTransferRequest &request, QIODevice *data)
db:section.db:para: Sends the contents of data to the remote device identified by request, and returns a new QBluetoothTransferReply that can be used to track the request's progress.
If the platform does not support the Object Push profile, this function will return 0.
